reviewText:
APB Reloaded is an interesting type of creature. On one hand it is a brilliant way to spend time with your mates and have a laugh, and on the other hand it is annoying beyond belief.

APB Reloaded is Cops vs Criminals taken to a much larger scale. 100 people (50 Enforcers vs 50 Criminals) are in one instance of part of a city. By no means is it as large as Grand Theft Auto's expansive worlds. The city isn't too convincing either, as the AI is nothing to be proud of. The driving AI is horrendous, like, horrendous. If their path is blocked by a car in the middle of the road, one would assume that they would pass it. No. They stay there, waiting. This leads to queues of AI Cars. The AI out of the car is not too pleasing either.

The cars in this game handle as if they are on ice. Many of the cars slip and slide across the road with little control. This can prove a challenge to overcome at first.

The starting guns in APB Reloaded, the 'STAR 556' and 'Obeya FBW' are good enough for those who are starting up in APB Reloaded. However, the others guns within the game are more powerful that the starting weapons, so this proves an unfair advantage against the beginner.

The game works around a system of in-game purchases. After completing a mission you are given Cash. Cash can be used to rent guns, buy outfits, buy cars, customise the look of your character/cars and so on. The cost of a relatively good weapon is around 5-8 mission's worth of Cash. Missions tend to take from 10 minutes up to 20 minutes. So around 2 hours work will get you a new gun for one week. After the week expires, the gun is removed from your inventory. If you wish to buy a permanent gun you have to get one through the Armas Marketplace. G1C, otherwise known GamerFirst Credits must be bought through real life money. The guns that can be bought through the Marketplace are high end and pack a definite punch. Some guns on the Marketplace can be trialled for one hour to give you a taster before purchase. The system works well, when it isn't against you.

The matchmaking system in APB Reloaded is dependant upon your Threat Level. Depending on your ability, you will be graded from bad to good, Green, Bronze, Silver, Gold. You may be teamed up with a Bronze fighting a Silver, or a Silver against a Gold. It sounds as if it could not go wrong. But unfortunately, the system does not factor in what guns the user is currently using at the time. Two Bronzes might have bought weapons from the Armas Marketplace and a Silver is using the stock weapons. It doesn't work.

Overall, APB Reloaded is a mixed bag of fun and straight up annoyance. Just make sure that you play with mates, or else this will prove to be more of a chore to play than fun.

reviewText: So, I wrote a review about this game a while back. But seeing how I didn't play much of it, I thought i'd give it another chance. So I went over to a friends house who had a better built PC, and played it there. After all this time... Still sucks. It's just another Pay-To-Win grind-fest. You either shell out 30 bucks for a gun that probably isn't very good, or you play for weeks and weeks only to be able to buy some freaking shoes, or some other low-end customization thing. The player creation screen is still confusing as all hell. The guns are generic and firefights are just the same everytime. Controls are clanky and slow. Cars handle like theyre on ice. And now, there are hackers on basically every server. So... Have fun with that. The Devs seem to be completely out of touch with their Fanbase" because these have been problems for about a full 2 years. There are also never any sales or community events. that 99.99 DLC went on sale ONCE for 69.99

reviewText: The relaunch of APB was proper, given the potential of the game, and the new free-to-play format is well suited to the characteristics of this discrete action game-style sandbox. The addition of new locations and the optimization of certain mechanics have certainly had the merit of making the experience more pleasant and multifaceted, and we must add that the outlay of real cash is absolutely not a requirement, especially not at the beginning They have high expectations and want to evaluate the product well. However a number of shortcomings is not insignificant relative to the controls, the feeling of weapons and, not least, the quality of the matchmaking and connection in general. It will therefore be interesting to see how and what APB Reloaded will be improved between now and a few months. As new beginning however, it is moderately encouraging.

reviewText:
APB:R Is a truly outstanding freemium game, You get the large choice of trying to keep peace and order as an enforcer, or burn, smash and wreck the city San Paro.
This games offers a new level of customization, you cannot only costumize your self, but your cars, clothes, spray, music, and more.

You will be able to enjoy this one of a kind urban freemium game to the max, even if youre a F2P, Because P2P called Premiums ingame, only get 25% bonus on their income from missions and misc, aswell as their reputation.

This game is highly enjoyable with a friend, and there is plently of room to freeroam in the streets and highways of San Paro.

Criminal: Ram storefronts, Mug people, sell cars, deliver goods, or cause a random destruction! A criminal's limits of income is his fear of being witnessed by any enforcer.

Enforcer: Pin down the Criminals as youre slowly stalking them, and as you see they get more and more dirty cash on them you witness them the last secound to take their loot and return it as edvidence for a big reward. As an enforcer youre not allowed" to drive down neutral npcs nor destroy the enviroment such as a mailbox.

The Graphics: The graphical level of this game is also at its max

reviewText: This game goes the extra mile for making everyone unique if you're willing to pay some money. That's not bad, but the actual game is. Controls are awkward and the sandbox maps feel grand at first but after exploring for a small amount of time I was already back where I had started. Aiming always feels off, and you have to focus way too much on it if you want to kill someone far away or not injured at all. Missions in sandbox mode are not always fair since they could match you with someone 4 times your level. This game could've been great but the gameplay and controls are sketchy and cars suck too. If you're bored on a weekend, try it, but if you're looking for a Saints Row here you are not going to find it at all.\nThree out of Ten.

reviewText:
Been playing since Real Time Worlds. Very customized, upgraded, armed characters. Migrated account when G1 took over. Had a lot of fun. Bought lots of G1 items. Premium too. In one of the first ban sweeps I was banned.  Apparently they erroneously banned over 2000 people when this happened. I got unbanned. Then got banned again the next day. Contacted G1; my support ticket was locked, I was banned from G1 forums after posting what happened, and all my accounts were locked. Over $100 down the drain, and my RTW character. Avoid this game. It had a time when it was good; that time is not now. Maybe when they upgrade to the next Unreal engine but besides that, avoid. Bad customer service, money hungry devs, rage-filled community, very PTW items and fair matchmaking does not exist. The Bronze Gold Silver tier matchmaking just doesn't work. Avoid.

Pros: good customization
Cons: Angry player base, PTW weapons, bad customer service, money hungry devs, unbalanced matchmaking


---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

reviewText: APB Reloaded seems to be a good idea on paper. What is that idea? Make an online multiplayer game that somewhat seems to be based off of GTA. Does this idea work? I'd say it's a tad mix of both yes" and "no".\n\nTo begin
date: you can choose from two "factions" and these are the criminals and the police. The criminals commit crimes and work together to cause as much chaos as possible. These can be as simple as stealing a car and ramming over many pedestrians or working together to rob stores and escape. Eventually
recommended: you will cause enough trouble and then you will become a target for the cops (who happen to be controlled by other players). While creating chaos can be fun
hoursPlayed: I found myself working alone and seeing many other criminal players doing the same thing. I hardly saw two criminals working together during my playtime. Being a target for the cops isn't much fun either as the main goal for the cops seemed to be just finding you and killing you. They don't try to arrest you or anything of the sort; they just chase you and bring you down with bullets. After you die
voteText: you just respawn and do it all over again. There are some sort of missions in the game but I wasn't given the slightest clue to where they were. I found a suitcase and was told to deliver it to some location but don't expect the map to get you anywhere as it wasn't much for help.\n\nAfter derping around with the criminal faction I played the cop faction. Problem is
helpfulPercent: I found difficulty in even finding my way out of the spawn area and
votesHelpful: as stated before
votesTotal:
the map isn't much for help. My best guess is that the cop faction patrols the city area and is given a list of target criminals to find and gun down.

Here's a short list of pros and cons that include some points that were not covered:
+ Vehicles handle differently in an appropiate manner
+ Graphics look fairly good
+ Creating chaos is enjoyable
+ Fair amount of character and vehicle customization
+ Basic free roaming is entertaining
- Map is hard to deal with
- Difficult to find missions
- Little teamwork
- Slight lag issues
- Police only shoot down criminals
- Community is known to be a little less than friendly

Eventually the confusion and constant deaths bored me and I can't recommend this game to anyone. It'll be nice to uninstall this game to make room for a more deserving one."

reviewText:
The game itself is alright, the customization is great. Everything else sucks..to simply to put it.

Terrible community but an even worse support. They spend more time on trying to make a fast buck over helping players who were falsely banned. Whether you pay or not you're on their ignore list. If you try posting on the G1 forums they'll lock the thread and tell you to submit a support ticket, and if you submit a ticket, you'll get an automated-response that doesn't help you at all. The matchmaking is unbalanced, 9/10 times I get opposition that suck so bad they accuse me of hacking, apparently that isn't better than you will call you a hacker. There's a handful of exploits that people take advantage of. People will grief you constantly. There's only 4 maps total, 2 of them are pretty much just deathmatches. It's not pay2win but it the weapons are significantly better so in the right hands they can make a person unstoppable. There's a variety of missions but more or less repetitive. Enforcers get stun guns which can become very annoying very quickly, marketplace items are beyond overpriced. If you have no friends to play with in this game, it can really disappoint. Every so often you'll also come across hackers.

OVERALL

Game: 7/10
Community: 4/10
Support: 0/10

Total: 11/30

In other words, don't waste your time on a game that won't waste its time on you.

reviewText:
An extremely poor game, riddled with hackers and bugs. This game was originally a subscription based game run by an EA owned company, but they folded and RELOADED Productions picked this game up, hence the game being renamed to APB Reloaded. The European servers I can only describe as awful, with many experiencing critical lag spikes and rubber banding. Some experienced hackers even use methods to lag switch, increasing your ping- forcing you to stay in one place; while he/she can shoot you on the spot. The hacking in this game is awful, the game company are powerless to stop it, and they have refused to update the game's anti-hack engine to sort this out. To add to insult, it's considerably easier for Criminals to make more money than enforcers, and many people have an account on both, one low ranked criminal that farms money from ram raids, and one enforcer who's a high rank and gets given the money through another account.

THE GAME: Gameplay is of a basic F2P 3rd person shooter, overly average graphics, with below average gunplay (some sub machine guns kill in 5 hits, while an assault rifle in a bigger calibre may take 7, go figure). This game is extremely pay to win, with many locks put on the player as a F2P member. See all those awesome car decals? That player's got premium. So you got premium, you've made your car but it looks all pixely? That's their new decal system, to skimp on money they lowered the texture qualities so they didn't have to purchase more servers (confirmed from staff from inside source). Many of the buy with real money guns are overpowered as heck, killing in half the time of in-game cash guns, while also being more accurate and considerably faster to reload.

THE FORUMS: Don't use them. A nasty throwback to the past, and rife with overtly corrupt staff. There are many stories of people being banned for hacks, when they get unbanned for no reason by an Admin, the two suddenly emerge as best of friends, and anyone who argues is labelled a troll and silenced. Also, some of the moderators aren't even old enough to play the game, when they recruited Forum Mods they didn't check ages all too well, and I can name a few mods who aren't old enough to play the game, let enough be a member of staff. Finally, the banning system in this game (when it works) is highly flawed. A few people have been banned innocently, but the game company refuses to hear your quarrels, as it has a policy of not contacting people on banned accounts. Have fun watching all that money get sucked away!

VERDICT: Waste of memory, this game had so much potential under EA (something rarely said) but the company who created this went bankrupt, and RELOADED products sucks. Don't get the game, it's a waste of time and memory- with nearly 550 hours on it I should know. I'll give this game a rating of 2/10, with lag spikes and hacks breaking gameplay, with a poor out of game support system too.

reviewText: After sinking alot of hours and money into this game I think I can review it. When I first started playing around 3 years ago it was great and I instantly fell in love with it, I spent money on G1C and made cars, clothing and bought guns and had fun designing different personas and because the customization is amazing you could make Miley Cyrus, make a tour van, get guns to suit her, make your theme when you kill someone her song and make your tour van blast out an entire song of hers. Or you could just make ♥♥♥♥♥ and hentai like 80% of people do there. The game in that sense is amazing but when it comes to combat it is still fun for the most part but has horrible matchmaking, hitboxes, ranking system. Lets say you are a Trainiee (The lowest rank and level 9) and you press K to ready up in a mission you will most likely get put against a Gold level 205 who has no fall damage, kevlar, fast car and a rocket launcher and that completely ruins the experience and they've even added a district with NO matchmaking so whoever presses K to enter a mission gets put with anyone and to me that seems like a cheap way to add stuff to the game without trying to fix anything and lets say you were to pull up next to your friend and run over his toe at 2mph he will die... INSTANTLY and that just makes the whole combat feel slow, broken and horrible.\n\nThere are three sets of money in this game, dollars, Joker Tickets and G1C, dollars are earned by selling on the ingame markey place, so cars and symbols, songs and themes and are earned by doing missions, killing people on bounty and such, its grindy to earn as a cop and ok to earn as a criminal as you can simply steal from stores on a low populated district and earn around 100k in a couple of hours but it gets broken by the fact that premium members who pay for membership get more money per mission and such and so the person whos talented at designing songs or symbols or who has the money to buy premium gets richer faster. Joker tickets are earned by completeling a set of objectives in Fight Club districts where its basically team deathmatch and you will get notifications like Kill 5 people with granades" and you will get another after that and then you can earn Joker Tickets. These can be spent on getting temporary perks like car surfer to ride on cars or normally expensive weapons and cars

reviewText:
(For all of you looking at my 600 hours, I actually have 1000+).

Let me begin by saying that this is a one-of-a-kind MMO that I fell in love with the first time I was allowed into the closed beta. The games character customization blew me away, and quickly became my favorite part of the game, and to this day is the only thing I genuinely care about in terms of APB's overall content.

Combat is a different story. I can't even consider it to be combat much more than I consider it to be dancing. There's just a huge learning curve to this game. Back in the day, people use to jump and snipe. It was the most stupidest thing ever designed into a shooter. The game feels to be a bit ridiculous sometimes, that I just up and quit after about an hour. Along with that, I have a short list of complaints in my head with this game, and I'll just point have you read them here.

1: The community can be sort of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ to new players. Even I at once would badger these 13 year old kids who barely found out what a microphone was, but I learned that it didn't help with anything, except maybe my ego. There are so many new players who just get put down by all the grizzled veterans that they see no reason to continue playing this god-forsaken game, and they would be pulling a smart move. There is a huge lack of motivation to stay in the game, unless of course you meet certain people that you can have a good time with. Even then however, the game makes it very hard to maintain a positive attitude.

#2: I use to part of a team of testers known back in the day as SPCI. It was a group picked by individuals who cared for the game, and also its testers. I admit I didn't do as much as others, but I was there when it came to the problems we faced. For one, whenever an upcoming patch needed testing, sometimes we were limited to only a day to do it. Now for most people, they couldn't test every day of the week, even me. Whoever could took a huge load of work. Once bugs and critical elements were reported, we'd expect G1 to be on top of these reports and fix them. This never ever happened in my experience. Sometimes these bugs wouldn't be addressed for months, sometimes never. It was this lack of action that made a lot of us question if what we were even doing was being appreciated. Eventually it all fell apart. Now there is a new team, whom I don't know, that either care about the game, or just want in on the upcoming content. In layman's terms, the new team to me feels like a bunch of complacant slaves who just want to have some imaginary" form of authority in the APB community. So yeah

reviewText:
There are plenty of things wrong with this game but in spite of this APB: Reloaded remains one of my all time most enjoyable games to play with friends.

Regardless of what most negative reviews will say this game is not pay to win. Cheats have been an issue for years though, and only recently has there been any significant response from Gamers First to combat them.

The biggest issue with the game is the matchmaking system, although it may work on a high populated game there just aren't enough players to split across 3 threat levels. Gold ranked districts are seldom active so even if they do not wish to gold ranked players are forced to de-threat" by playing bad till they become silver. Once these gold players are silver ranked they can play in the bronze districts till they log out and are not even forcibly removed once they reach gold again. As a result new players are thrown in at the deep end quite early in their APB career and quickly find they're out-matched and out-gunned.

If you're a hardcore first person or third person shooter fan you'll likely not enjoy this game. If you intend to play solo you will likely not enjoy this game. If however you have 1-3 friends to play with and are capable of not taking the game too seriously it's worthy of a download.

8/10"

reviewText:
Hi,

Well it's been a while i've been playing this game as you can see..

In a resume.

A quick word about the community : You'll venture into different personnality
Some that you will have never thought to be friend with or that you would have never thought they would led you a chance to be friend with them ;
Others that you will regret having known;
Some that you will love with the deepest of your heart;

Be pleasant to others and they'll be pleasant to you otherwise if you're an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ it will just ends up in like any other online videogames and you'll be ignored like a ghost.

-Gameplay-

A gameplay that you will never be able to experience anywhere else. Why?

Well there's a maximum of possibility to be done within this game. The possibilities of what you are capable of are the limits of your consciousness.

The character customization : you can make your own tattoos apply them where ever you want. You can decide to look like a brocoli with a green afro and a green skin tone by example.

Vehicle customization : Apply decals where ever it's possible in your field of view. Make it unique differ from the default style that you'll see in game. Make yourself noticeable while driving in the most well made customization. It takes patience but afterward you'll be rewarded for your efforts with positive comments in team chat while in a mission or group chat with your new friends you'll have created.

Clothing customization : Same as the others above..i've seen and met a lot of great artists in this game. Be kind with them they are argued and rushed by others to make requests and they'll get tired overall if you're abusing of them but other then that many of them are the most greatest persons i've ever seen in this game. Pleasant to talk with them.

Many variant driving style : Most of all the vehicles you'll drive in this game as a unique handling with time you'll get to know every of them and be drifting around with style dodging rockets of your enemies perfectly etc etc.

Combats: I've learned over time that you need to act wisely as you move towards your enemies. Detect their positions move with awarness of where they could possibly come from. Be prepared paranoy if you have to but not too much. Call their positions to your team it helps a lot.

Every players as a different style to attack their ennemies i'm the kinda guy to be sneaky.

You have an enormous amount of weapon possibilities in this game. You'll have to learn the time to kill of each of them. The time it takes to recuperate your bloom and so on you know where i'm going with that..

Overall with the game my experience :

I've appreciated every minutes that i've passed in this game i will never regret and will never be losing any of the good memories i had with any of you that might be reading this. No one will be forgotten for those that i loved and shared the most grateful gaming session of my first Online gaming experience. So many good memories..so many laughs..


This game is printed as a good souvenir in my memory for the rest of my life sadly haha.. ;)

Oh btw every games can get through  issues but i'm glad of the efforts that the staff did to resolve them in an order of priorities because they have a list of priorities that can be more important to respect in order to stabilize the game to make it suitable.

I was glad to be a volunteer for this game as a Open Beta Tester for APB:Reloaded; APB:R Forum moderator & San Paro City Tester. For the time it lasted.

I recommend this game.

Have fun and hold on might be rough as you start but with time you'll eventually get better unless it's not your priority and you're just looking for a good time.

iHope you enjoy this game as i did.


<3

reviewText:
This game used to be awesome. Keywords are 'used to'. Now it's just a circlejerk of hackers, rerollers - experienced players who make new characters 'cos can, troll characters - characters that are meant to look as hideous as possible, and a company that does a really poor job of not only getting rid of the hackers - they usually just ban innocent players - but making the game run well. It runs on an outdated engine and is poorly optimized. I have state-of-the-art hardware in my computer, and even with the graphics turned up to the fullest there is still aliasing, texture and animation problems. The company who owns this game, GamersFirst - they didn't make the game, but instead revived it from the company who originally created the game but had to shut down for some reason, can't even make good content for the game. The last, like, four weapons they've added have been reskins of existing weapons. But these ones you can only get by spending REAL MONEY to get, and it's not cheap either. Permenant weapons for a single character are forty dollars. FORTY DOLLARS. I could buy a completely new game with that.

The thing this game does well at is the customization, my God is it amazing... Only if you are a wizard at making symbols; otherwise you look absolutely stupid. The designers for symbols and themes - you can make a five second tune, usually an ear-piercing screech, that someone hears when you kill them or become MVP - aren't the most user friendly, and because of that there are only a handfull of people who can decently make them.

The gameplay is really repetitive and grindy; do the objectives and shoot the bad guys. The objectives don't mean crap, though. You can do all the objectives, but if you don't kill anyone you get barely anything. You level up at a snail's pace unless you, or course, spend REAL MONEY to get Premium, which allows you to get insane bonuses - something like 200% - to money and experience incomes.

I started playing this game right around the time it came out, and it was fun for a while, but for the past year the only thing that has kept me playing is the hope that GamersFirst would do SOMETHING to fix this crap-heap of a game. I would not reccomend you play it. If you do play it, however, do NOT spend any money on this game - it's dying, and fast.

reviewText:
APB Reloaded is a cops and robbers MMO that couldn't quite pull it off. The game has SO much potential that it almost makes me angry when they fall short on almost every game features. The lack of locational damage means accuracy is not needed. Combat often ends in a jumping match, and corner camping is one of the few strategies thanks to the third person camera.

The games micro transaction system and F2P model are majorly flawed. When buying guns in game you rent them allowing you to use it for a set amount of time before you have to rent it again. Buying an account bound weapon costs more but allows any of your characters to use it. This will run you anywhere from 20-55 dollars. You can also purchase character bound weapons for less, these cost about 10-40 dollars. When buying cars you can do the same rent, or own. An account bound car will run you about  15-35 dollars.

All of these prices can be discounted by owning a premium subscription.
Other premium benefits include a 20% off the cost of premium subscriptions, up to a 90% bonus to all Contact Standing (XP) Gains, 125% bonus to all Cash gains, 20% discount in the Armas Marketplace, 50% reduced cool down on activated abilities (Field Supplier / Nitro Booster), advanced access to Customization Suites (50 Symbols per Vehicle / Clothing item. 100 layers per Symbol), removal of in-game premium subscription advertising (which pops up at the end of every other mission), extended duration for Armas Trials for Weapon and Vehicle Trials.

Premium costs about 10 dollars for 30 days and gets cheaper the more time you buy. All in game prices are set in G1C which come in inconvenient amounts to make you buy more or additional packs. An example of this is a non-premium 1 month subscription costs 999 points. You can only get 999 points by buying spending $15 (1200 credits) because $10 is only 800 credits.

The best part of this 3rd person MMO shooter is the customization. While it is extremely limited as a non-premium user you can still add some flavor to your character or vehicle. Premium allows for you to create a truly unique look with 50 Symbols per Vehicle / Clothing item. At 100 layers per Symbol.

The in game missions are not over exciting and after playing for about 2-3 hours you will have played all of the available missions. Other players not in your mission are still in the world and can interact with you. They can do things like ram your vehicle or block you in buildings, but it is difficult for them to directly kill you.

The favored anti-cheat system of APB is Punkbuster. This program doesn't work very well at all and allows hackers to run rampant. In my short amount of play time I had encounter roughly 1 hacker per hour.

Overall this game has such a great idea, yet such terrible terrible execution in nearly everything the developers tried to do.

reviewText:
The game in it's current state, I definitely cannot recommend. It has some pretty awesome customization, but thats honestly about all that keeps me coming back. The matchmaking is terrible, and there has only been cash shop item releases (no new real content) since G1 took over. They say proper new content will be possible once they finish the engine upgrade, but they've been promiseing the upgrade for 3+ years and it still seems it'll never be here. They also plan to overhaul the matchmaking system, which will definitely help keep new players around, as the system they have in place now is often exploited by veterans, and will end up matching them against newbies. With the fairly steep and long learning curve the game has, few will stick around to get the hang of it after getting steamrolled constantly.

tl;dr
I would recommend this game once the matchmaking has been overhauled, and the engine upgraded, but in it's current state, it's skippable.

reviewText: Product received for free\n\nI may have a lot of hours invested into this game over the course of several years, but I would not recommend this to anyone in it's current state. With only 2 major maps to explore and play on and 2 smaller traditional arena type maps (one of which is just a slight modified version of an area that exists in one of the 2 large maps.) reviewText:
Although this game has lots of potential, I myself have found a few things wrong with it:

Firstly, the game is simply too resource-demanding. I myself have an Alienware 14 with a NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M, and 8GB of memory. To start with, this $1,000 laptop barely even runs this game on moderate graphics settings, forcing me to switch to low-end graphics just so the game can have a smooth, playable framerate. MAYBE this is something wrong with my laptop, but I think not.

Even playing on the lowest graphics settings possible, the game still manages to lag and otherwise have random FPS drops that would often result in instant death in the middle of a firefight. The vehicle control feels a little too arcade-y for my liking. In addition, there is a rather alarming population of cheaters on servers. Utilizing a mathematical formula—100 missions played, averaging 4 players to each faction for each mission—I found that over the course of those 100 missions that a total of 89 people were hacking in some way, shape, or form. If we conclude that in 100 missions that you will encounter 700 people (800 minus yourself in each mission), there is an average hacker ratio of 0.127 (12.7%). While Reloaded Production's newest Fair Fight Anti-Cheat Technology should help reduce this number, I still can see a large population of hackers managing to bypass this.

Regarding the servers, their software is outdated and faulty at best. Only the dedicated servers seem to run anywhere near smoothly, but even then their calculation systems and arithmatic formulas often result in a laggy experience.

Pros:

Decent graphics
Dynamic gameplay
ENDLESS character customization

Cons:

Requires a high-end gaming laptop in order to run smoothly
Arcade-esque vehicle handling
Combat utilizes hit-scans, which often bugs
Outdated servers
High hacker population

Overall score: 5.1/10.

This game USED to be fun, but sadly, they have moved away from their original roots of entertainment. The best that I can say about it is that it is merely a laggy, ramped-up version of cops-and-robbers that we all played as little kids. If you are looking for a decent F2P game, I would advise you to look elsewhere.

The concept of this game is really cool. Its kinda like a GTA online shooter, its completly open world and the customization possibilities are HUGE! You can literally create everything for your character!

A big downside of this game is the ingame shop. Im playing at gold rank without any premium stuff and weapons and 90% of my opponents are just people with premium to get more money and Golden Weapons with max Upgrades from the store. Not having these can make the game very frustrating since your opponents will just be stronger in any way without much skill. They reg Health faster, their weapons deal more dmg, their accuracy is higher. For example there is a premium SHOTGUN, that hits you for almost full dmg without being in melee combat, which is highly frustrating to play against. This is just an example.

The principle of the game is still fun, but the P2W model ruins it a lot in my opinion.

reviewText:
APB on the surface is an amazing game. Being able to play the role of a vigilate cop or a hardened criminal is enticing, and the fully customizable characters, cars, and tattoos are awesome features to boot. However, when you download the game and play it for a day or two, you quickly realize that the grandeour of what was promised is simply just not delivered...

While true the custimization is a very developed feature, the actual gameplay is less than desirable. Essentially missions are the same across the board, either defend somthing, or attack and maybe shuttle a car or an object (cocaine, evidence, ect...) to a specified area. During that time, it's a slugfest between the players who have no sense of cooperation, or are just ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s in general. More on that later though

The guns in APB serve genaric roles, short, medium, or long range with the option of sidearms to compensate for weaknesses. The guns are generally ok, but the ones bought from the ARMA shop (paid with real cash) offer significant advantages to the vanilla guns, such as longer range, higher ammo capacity, and faster rate of fire. Now, the vanilla guns have the capacity to rival these weapons, but it takes an incredible amount of experience with the gun of your choice (SMG, Assualt Rifle ect...) to gain access to the mods that will alter the weapon.

So it can be argued that this game isn't pay to win because the players who don't pay can EVENTUALLY rival the people who do pay, there is a very noticable difference in power, and you'll see it too. The weapon I most often see against me is the Whisper" submachine gun varient. It is designed to hide muzzle flash and noise while also boosting range at a negligible difference in stopping power. This weapon is only available with real money
date: and while you can mod a submachine gun to get some benefit
recommended: the silencer is exclusive to the "Whisper". This gives a player an incredible advantage over other players who dont want to pay. This is just one example though
hoursPlayed: there are multiple weapons on the ARMA market that offer similar exclusive features not found anywhere in the vanilla game. It makes going against these players incredibly frustrating to go against

Its a lot of fun, but I wouldn't recommend it if you're one of those - like me - who gets frustrated when you die.

This is a game of skill. There's no classes and no real perks or talents that can give you an advantage in a fire fight.
Buying weapons character modifications (such as body armor) can increase your chances, but only slightly and will not necessarily make it impossible for a new player to kill you if you make a mistake.

reviewText: Anyone looking for a new kind of MMO should give APB: Reloaded a download. While the Armas Marketplace offers a wide variety of weapons, vehicles, and aesthetic items be assured that this is a well balanced Free to Play title and requires no purchase for the full experience. Character customization reaches a whole new level with their persona, outfit, vehicle, and symbol editors and the maps themselves are created with great detail.\nThough the game can be difficult to learn at first, as the mechanics are quite different from most other open-world shooters, and the Armas Marketplace suffers from the same tragically over-inflated prices that most Free to Play games tend to this is a very solid game with a lot to offer. Action is always guaranteed and with plenty of unlocks and mission types you're sure to find yourself unable to walk away easily.

reviewText:
My experience of APB Reloaded in a nutshell

I pressed k
Game puts me in match against enforcers lvl 1000+
We have to defend teh wepoons
2 enforcers get rekt by our mighty forces of criminals
Jimmy gets rekt by a bomb
There's 4 of us left defending teh wepoons
We get ambushd by 2 enforcers with grenades
We r all ded
Enforcers capture wepoons
Jimmy joins back in only to get rekt 3 seconds after he spawns by a big bulky car
The rest respawn and go to the next defense point with their supercars,but leave me alone in the middle of nowhere
Half of the team dies again because they got rekt by car with 3 people in it
The rest of us shoot the car
Guy in the back of car shoots a missile at Billy
He and hitman dies
Im alone
4 enforcers leave their cars and try to kill me
They start shooting a car while i take cover
Car explodes making every other conviniently placed car to explode and kill me
I respawn and get shot by a pikachu
I respawn and go with a little group of the team
We shoot enforcers and kill them
A group of enforcers kill us
I respawn only for a garbage bus to smoosh me
I respawn with Jimmy and we go on a magical trip together
All of a sudden, bonnie appears out of nowhere,throws a giant grenade at us and kill us
Everyone in team is ded for unknown reasons
Enforcers destroy the remaining wepoons and we lose

11/10 would press k again

reviewText:
A pretty below average game in my honest opinion. It not only uses an old Unreal Engine, but has many limits, in terms of draw distance, fake bloom effects and jagged shadows.

Even while having a powerful rig, this game will still run poorly, which may also explain the decreasing numbers of people playing the game. I know people who have played this years ago and are no longer able to handle the game due to terrible performance.

Theres a poor choice of missions in this game such as: Defuse bomb, Ramming, Stealing which is basically all a click f" to wait while this circle fills up to 100% and offers no challenge whatsoever.

However
date: props to RTW for creating a game with such amazing customization
hoursPlayed: and may be the only reason why i play this."

reviewText:
Don't believe the people who say that this isn't a pay to win game.
Someone who has played this for about 2-3 years will still fall behind someone who spent $100+ and only months (sometimes weeks) in this game.
After logging in almost 500 hours in this game I can say that it does get really repetitive. I gave up around the time hackers ruled the servers. Even with this new system out I'm very hesistant to go back.
Cusomization is nice.. only if you pay for extra slots.
Seriously unless you're the trophy wife or gay secret lover of Bill Gates who will willingly give you lots of money, I don't suggest spending a dime on this.

reviewText:
1st take - If you're not willing to spend real money it is pretty much unplayable. Hacking,macro cheating, and golds purposely farming lowbies galore. Maybe if G1 got their act togethor i would say its a worthwhile game...but they're making to much money off the p2w guns to even care.

2nd take - Fairfight solved some of the hacker problems, but i still would not recommend this game yet.
Only good thing going for it at the moment is the sheer amounts of customization. But there is still to many glaring problems that needs to be addressed.

1.Matchmaking - The matchmaking in this game is atrocious, it makes leagues matchmaking system look flawless ( and thats bad) . Odds are you will be placed against people who are gold and R255 while you are just starting out. (even if you go to bronze servers they're still there)

2. Armas Weapons - This is the big one, Armas weapons is a double edged sword. Yes it is whats keeping the game afloat since it brings in revenue. But also its whats making the game completely unbalanced. Though i would think this could be easily fixable by adding ranks to the armas weapons, so a brand new character cant run around with a shaw first blood".

3. This ties into 1
date: but the fact golds can stay in bronze servers. This could be easily fixed that once you hit gold you are automatically booted out of the server.\n\n4.They need to find a way to hire actual GM's
recommended: cause there's is a load of people who need to banned just for the way they act in this game. If players were actually afraid of losing all their work and the real money they spent on armas. Maybe the community would be less toxic.\n\nThese are only some of the problems
hoursPlayed: maybe after these are fixed i could actually approve this game to new players."

reviewText:
If you enjoy grinding consistently for months/years and forking out Hundreds to Thousands of dollars a year for a premium membership and/or Pay2Win weapons, then this game was made specifically for YOU.
If you enjoy a fun time without having to deal with absurd gunplay, lag, wonkey driving, hackers, pay2wins, and the worst gaming community of all time, then stay farrrr away from this game.

THE COMMUNITY IS ONE OF THE WORST I'VE EVER SEEN,  worse than LoL's. If you DO want to play this game, hide the chat. As it is constantly popping up with stupid kids and childish adults yelling at each other / falsely accusing someone of hacking / or just complaining about the game they are playing.

It truely is sad, this game has the best customization in a game  EVER.  But it is wasted on a cash grab like this game. GamersFirst is one of the worst companies of all time, worse than EA. Basically, what the did was this: They resurected this game, which was originally created by another company. Since then, they have done jack sh*t to the game, all new content has been added in the form of paid content. They receive a**loads of money from premium members, yet they can't even keep their servers going. This company took a great game (which caused the sad end to an original and innovative company) and turned it into nothing but a cancerous money grab.

Screw professionalism. Do not give your money to this piece of sh*t game, it's f**ing terrible, and it can be like cigarettes to some people once you get too far into it, luckily I got out. Go play a decent and balanced Free to Play, like Team Fortress 2, Planetside 2, or even Blacklight: Retribution. Stay away from this piece of sh*t, and don't let the awesome customization fool you into giving it a chance, it's better to just ignore it and spend your time on a game that actually deserves it.

Pros
Awesome customization (character and vehicle)
Great driving (can be a bit wonky at first, but once you get the hang of it nothing beats drifting around huge corners in the vegas)
Great asthetic style
Original idea
Challenging
Requires Teamwork
Integrated Clans and Groups
Built in Music player which allows you to broadcast your own songs to other players
Built in Audio Workstation to create your own short theme(s) that play to other players after you've killed them. (If you produce music like I do you will have some fun with this one)
Built in market for players to sell clothing, cars, weapons, themes and other in-game items.
Two Fun and Fairly Large Maps
Sharp on-foot controls
Gunplay focuses more on gun stats, range, and how many hits were landed, damage is not locational
No bullsh** gun-play, shots will hit where your crosshair lands, but their is recoil / shot spread
Cons
Most of the new/cool content you have to pay real money for
Laggy servers
Hackers
Total Grind
Overpriced Premium Membership and paid items
Absolutely HORRID community
Non-locational damage
Some Pay2win Weapons
High level players have an obvious advantage over lower levels, so you have to rely on the matchmaking to pair you against a team of similar levels, which it doesn't.
Some features available for free in the past were cut and put back in as paid content (Vehicle Body Kits)
Everyone in the social district seems like they're in a coma, everyone just stands around completely still and silent
Player-bought/won billboards in social district almost ALWAYS has at least one containing nudity and or hentai
Some absolutely awful missions. For example, in a VIP Mission, the VIP player can get in a car, BUT the car will have something like a 50% speed reduction, but it doesn't matter, because it may take a while, but the car will eventually get up to full speed. So, if VIP gets into a car like the Vegas (fastest car in the game) they can get up to full speed and leave the opposition unable to catch up, even if they enter a vehicle of equal speed, as long as the VIP stays at a steady pace they will continue on at the same speed, so the VIP will gain ground at the same speed the Opp will gain on them, running out the clock and granting a win the cheap, ♥♥♥♥♥-tactic VIP.
Ghosting / Ghosters. For example if you are chasing a VIP in the scenario above you will likely get rammed into a wall / corner by some random ♥♥♥♥ who isn't even involved in your mission. Ghosting is usually due to players wanting to take out their aggression caused by the piece of ♥♥♥♥ game they are currently playing, so instead of beating off or screaming into a pillow or punching a wall or breaking things like normal people usually do to releive stress, these toxic children will usually ruin someone elses game experience instead. Hell, they don't even have to be specifically ghosters either, ♥♥♥♥ing with people in this game is so easy when in a car people will even do it while on their way to / on a mission themselves. And yes, if you haven't played this game, people who aren't in your mission can still hit, ram, and push your car, damage isn't done to either car but if pushed into a wall at a high enough speed the victim's car will take damage from the wall or even explode regardless.
Dump Trucks
Don't play this game.

reviewText:
I recommend this game.
Most of this review comes from Last August, which was when I last put a lot of hours into the game.
Recently I've been trying to get back into it.
If you want to play with me, I'm looking for people to play with on the Joker NA server.
Just started up a new character.
Anyways, here's the review:

This game is a lot, and I mean a lot of fun.
I'll be completely honest with you,
there used to be a lot of server lag, but now it's perfectly optimized.
It is so addicting and fun, with so many different customizations option for guns/clothing/vehicles/weapons it's just awesome.
I LOVE this game. I'm finally getting back into it after a while.

The things that I dislike:
The amount of time it takes to obtain a good amount of money. (it doesn't take that long if you have Premium.)
Premium could have... a little more benefits.
There seem to be a lot of cheaters.
It's somewhat hard to obtain certain vehicles, and atleast on The Joker server, it costs a lot for a good vehicle/mod/weapon/theme song.
That's pretty much it.

reviewText: Nice game and pretty fun to play for a while, but just as any f2p,the game does have some serious issues. In the case of apb,it's the balancing of the 2 factions,enforcers and criminals (=pigs and crims). While criminals are really fun to play,enforcers get a huge advantage over them by being able to witness them" and pretty much 2shot them (the combat mechanics of the game are: hold down your mousebutton
date: the one with the better weapon or first hit will win.)\nThe problem here is that the notoriety system of the game lets the pigs witness any criminal with a high enough rating. This gives cops a huge combat advantage
recommended: since you can't shoot cops as crim unless they witness you and start shooting.\n\nIf you dont mind balancing and serious hacker issues
hoursPlayed: you'll have a fun time
voteText: especially when playing with some mates."

reviewText:
OverviewGameplay: 2/10
Sounds: 5/10
Multiplayer: 6/10
Graphics: 7/10

Pros & Cons+ Limitless customization from characters to even theme songs
+ Decent map design
- Possibly the worst gun mechanics in any shooter game to date
- Glitches
- Horrible car control
- Unbalanced weapons
- Bugs
- All monetized items cost waaaaay too much. (50 USD for a weapon)
- Stiff animations

ConclusionAPB is one of those strange games that manages to do somethings really great and basically fail at everything else. The developers (Gamersfirst) do not listen to fans and sadly it reflects in the game. The animations are awful, the ragdolls feel like plastic bags, the streets are paved with invisible ice causing cars to slide everywhere, the gravity is set to reflect the moons' and don't even get me started on the gunplay. APB certainly has grown since RTW, but there is certainly lots of room for improvement.

5/10

reviewText:
I haven't played this using steam but over my two accounts I have over 1500 hours and it spans from 2011-2013 , and then rest of my second account is all from late 2014 to 2015.

The game had a lot of potential but the increasingly poor decisions of the people in charge are really putting the nail in the coffin as time goes on. The game was playable and enjoyable, FPS was good and there wasn't any lag. The game has cheaters but what F2P game doesn't?

Then as time goes on you lost FPS with every patch, you can no longer play on ultra settings but need to play it on low with a special launcher that reduces textures even further, I have upgraded my rig since I've first started playing and the performance I get is absolutely laughable.  The servers, for more than a month, have been having aboslutely awful connection problems due to getting ddosed" ( doubt it
date: probably just a lie) which result in constant ping spikes and people constantly teleporting around.\n\nBut as the game continues to go down the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥

reviewText:
ABC: Rebranded is the best mmofpsgtaclonerpgtrs of all time. You play as Alyx Vance in his quest to eradicate all the jews and take over middle-earth, and along the way you meet many companions, like Milhouse Manastorm and Winnie the Pooh. Most of the gameplay consists of building various structures with blocks, whilst at the same time micro-managing an array of different pokemon through space, as you build and customize your very own spaceship. Sadly there is no multiplayer, but the multiplayer campaign was very enjoyable, even if it does run through uplay for windows live. There are in theory three different endings, but it's really just the same ending with different Hatsune Miku songs playing in the background. The voice acting is a bit weird, since only the player character talks whilst all the NPCs have to choose from a drop-down list of responses to everything the player says, ultimately leading them to accept your quest. If the NPCs complete enough quests, you unlock the ability to date Ragnaros the Firelord, which takes place within a bejeweled-like mini-game. If you win you get porn.

Final verdict: 9/11
Would have rated it 13/37, but it's no use.
voteText: 13 of 23 people (57%) found this review helpful 22 people found this review funny

reviewText:
An interesting game. You could even call it a 'GTA MMORPG'.

Positive:
Many people play it
It's Free
Plenty of entertaining tasks to do plus free roam
You can play with friends in a group and/or form a clan
Massively in-depth customization of characters, vehicles and more!
Large open worlds
Has an Anti-Cheat
Negative:
Demanding (Hardware wise)
Certain things which may give a slight gameplay advantage are buyable with real money
Slow loading time (On my PC which is below recommended but above minimal requirements)
May seem like a grind
May be difficult to learn at first
The launching of the game (After the steam download) is very buggy
You need to create an account to play
Not the best community in the world
Overall, a great game. The negative list, while longer than the positive list, is overcome by the positives, and this free game is definitely worth a try.

7/10

reviewText:
Such a great game given a terrible name by the community. The mechanics in the game are very crisp, both shooting and driving and the customization options in the game are second to none. The avaliable maps to play in are fairly large and diverse so even though there are currently only two, you have tons of room to play around and explore.

Now on to the bad. First up, a large percentage of the players in this game tend to come off rather rudely. The ridiculous customization can also sometimes be slightly annoying (So many drawn ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥). The game suffers from some coding errors as well, resulting in occasional frame drops though usually they aren't too bad. APB has a reputation for being full up of cheaters and while there are certainly a few, the problem is for the most part over exaggerated.

Bottom line is this; Play the game, it's free and you might fall in love. If you don't? No big deal, it's free.

reviewText:
I originally played this game over two years ago on the Gamerfirst game client. I have to say that the game is full of potential and could be way better. Especially if there was more lore on the characters. Besides just being there some of the NPCs that you get missions from seem like a shell with no personlity. Like Double B or Seung Bloodrose.

The customization is very amazing and thats one of the key features that sells the game and that got me too play. Though I did hear about the game on a sims forum

After a while the missions get too repetitive.

____________

tl:dr, I don't recommend playing the game unless you play it with friends otherwise you'll be amazed by the customization and then be bored to death because of the repetiveness.  :D

reviewText: This game really need some tweaks... If you prefer not paying for a game before you know it's good, this is not a game for you.  APB Reloaded is the most pay2win game I've ever seen. Just the fact that you only have weapons for 10 days is just... Awful. If you wanted me to pay for your weapons, I'd like to get to keep them too! why would I buy something I can only keep for 10 days?! When I played my first games in bronze servers, they were filled with gold ranked people! I played this with my friend and didn't get the grenade you're supposed to get(needs to be fixed). The pay2win aspect of this game is just huge. This is like a worse version of CoD where people with skill get better weapons but are still matched with noobs. Some of the weapons you have to pay for i.e. Joker weapons are just really OP. How is it even possible to jump out of your car if someone can blow it up in to seconds with a freaking MG?! The missions are bad too. Not to mention the storylines. All you do is press someone, maybe read what they have to say, click a button called pledge" and do boring meaningless missions. i don't know how many actual missions there are. I'd imagine there's like 5 or 6. The moral is "if you have money
date: instantly get good at this game
hoursPlayed: play for a long time and still get killed by people who pay fortunes for this free to play game!". It also requires a pretty decent PC (another money requiring factor) and has a bunch of DLC. Overall I think it's a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ game with ♥♥♥♥♥♥ missions
voteText: ♥♥♥♥♥♥ microtransactions

reviewText:
APB, i sadly will give this a thumbs down not because its a bad game, its not its the lack of control over hacking in this game. Players tend to deny their use of aimbots and wall hacks but when you use the aimbot it tells you when someones aiming right at you through 2 or 3 walls. Also if your half way across the map and on a mission that does not directly tell you where another player maybe and your found, you know your dealing with something fishy.

Good side to the game is you instally feel like your playing what would be GTA Online, or a close comparison to it any how. Lots of actions, great gun selection, and character customisation thats unmatched, and i really do mean that lol, you will not find another game that lets you be unique as this game does.

All that said, IFFFF people weren't raging and using hacks or perhaps just being a game troll. Lets say all thats gone (Hopefully some day) I would give this game a 9 out of 10 for a score or maybe even a 9.5. The games not perfect but its pretty damn good.

If you like cheating then maybe this games for you, but i promise you this game will get on your nerves so much after a bit so i can't recommend this to anyone thats wanting a fair game play experiance.

Personally, I really like this game, and have devoted quite a while into it. The patches and all do move along at a somewhat slow rate, given the small dev team, but I think its actually a really good game. I read some of the other reviews and I will address some of the issues mentioned.

Pay2Win-
Basically every gun in the ARMAS Marketplace is a reskin of a gun you get from in-game progression, and the few execeptions have lots of downsides to balance their upsides. Anyone who claims that guns are p2w most likely hasn't gone to the cash shop and trialed the guns, which by the way, you can do, trialing all of the guns for 30minutes/3hours depending if you have premium membership. Really though, the in-game progression weapons are on par, or even better than their cash shop counterparts.

Hackers-
This community is so paranoid of hackers, its pretty much a given that either one person might seem like they are hacking, or you will get hackusated. Just realize that its possible that people are better than you, because some people have been around 4-5 years, since the start in RTW times.

Lag-
At the time of this post, one of the districts, Waterfront, has been rather laggy, but they have been working on a fix for it, and the lag only occurs when there are more than 60 people per instance (excess people can move to a different instance to fight the lag, but sometimes they just don't)

Okay, and one more thing, its not as if you are paying $60 + DLC galore, its a free game. I understand this game might not be for everyone, mainly people that can't accept that people are better than them, and resort to calling people hackers or calling weapons p2w. Give it a shot, though, because it truly is pretty good quality for a f2p game.

reviewText: If the game got rid of it's pay-to-win elements and instead just priced it at $5 or somewhere close, the game would be a slam dunk. reviewText:
Alright.

So, in a world where GTA V/GTA Online had not yet existed, Realtime Worlds (the creator of, among other things, Crackdown) decided to break the bank on an MMOFPS called All Points Bulletin, or APB.

It was a highly ambitious but deeply flawed experiment in open-world GTA-esque sandbox gamplay in multiplayer. There were a number of serious flaws to the game's design, implementation and operation that gave it pretty lousy reviews, and in the end it was one of the reasons why Realtime Worlds went into bankruptcy.

After this escapade, a holding company bought out the rights to IP ownership and services administration of APB, which would eventually become known as GamersFirst (a highly ironic title for a game company that seemingly throws everything they can get their hands on into a pay-to-win woodchipper as soon as possible).

These guys seemingly haven't done a whole lot else with the game besides random bugfixes that in the end might have made it impossible to play on my computer, either through the retail launcher or via Steam.

But when I WAS able to play it, there was a nugget of intrique buried in a pile of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ issues that prevented me from enjoying the game as a new player. The anti-cheat system was terrible, allowing for way too many impossible snipe-shots from other players in free-roaming or in missions, the community was pretty awful except for those who often hung out in the social servers (thus giving me an opportunity to entertain them by dancing like an idiot a few times, what MMOFPS fun) and player advancement was really meager as a result of how stratified the playerbase's levels of experience were.

To be fair though, there are some positives. The character/vehicle customization engine was mind-blowing at the time and is still pretty impressive today. If you can get together with people you know, you might enjoy causing havoc knowing that police dispatching is wholly reliant on the number of Enforcer players on the server and vice versa -- in other words, the world swings from one extreme to the other, chaos or dystopian order. It's pretty entertaining in that regard, I guess, although it's just a side effect of how unbalanced the game is.

Lastly, the missions I could get into were pretty entertaining in the world provided -- one of my favorite things about Realtime Worlds' open world games was the environment they designed for them. I don't exactly know why I enjoyed them, as they could be rather generic at times, but they always felt alive to me for some reason.

Maybe if a whole lot was changed about the game I'd consider going back to it (once I could ACTUALLY go back to it, as well) but in the meantime I'd not recommend this mediocre excuse for a massively multiplayer GTA. Now that GTA Online's out for PC, I'd suggest you check that out instead, its flaws are much more forgivable. It's weird that I can actually say that and mean it.
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Now I know my hours of gameplay for this game doesn't say much, but hear me out anyways.

APB:R is an open world MMO where the players could either be the criminals or the enforcers. The roles are quite self-explainatory

The gameplay itself is quite what you would expect from any other third-person game, run to cover, peep out, unload your guns, that or you could just jump out and spray your munition and pray that it lands on the target. The gameplay however isn't what fascinates me, it is the customization option that you apply to your ride or your player model. You can create your very own designs from scratch, whether or not it ends up as tattoo or a car decal, the endless possiblity of creation is simply just mind blowing (Provided that you unlock all the customization option). As someone who studies graphic designs, this is my nice cup of tea.

Note: Premium players can put in more customization items on their clothings/car/tattoos compared to f2p players.

Of course, since this is a free to play game there are in-game items that you can buy to give you an edge against your opposition. Personally however, I think this game is still reasonable even if you are a f2p player.

The only downside for me is probaly the community inside the game. I'm not sure about the other servers, but the server I'm currently residing in is just..just....  full of twelve years old who are uncapable of listening to reason and logic. Oh yeah. Also expect ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. Lots and lots of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.

reviewText:
APB Reloaded is excellent in one category, character customization. It has a much more in depth system than any other game out there. Everywhere else, APB is one of the worse games on the market. After spending some hours on it, doing customization, you want to run around and do actual missions. That's cool. Unfortunately everyone logged on is much higher ranked than you, has better guns, and 80% of them are griefers that will follow you around and screw with you after the game. Granted, if you wanted to spend the money on this game, you could have these overpowered guns that nearly make the game P2W, but the 1000 or less people that are actually playing the game, really don't make it worth it. Or the fact that the game is not optimized for really any type of PC, which means everyone is laggy, and driving at full speeds is nearly impossible without several random crashes, or becoming one with a building. In my personal opinion, do not waste any time of your life in this game. You'll spend most of the time you do customizing your character and thinking about how much you hate the rest of the gameplay offered. Save yourself time and frustration and do not click install.

Update - 2/11/16

This game is still horrible. I got the random idea of reinstalling it and trying it again. The only thing worthwhile in this game, is still character customization. It's still plagued by morons and horribly repetitive gameplay. I'm... still confused as to why I thought it might have changed. The whole 'fool me once' quote comes to mind. Lesson learned.

reviewText:
APB reloaded is a great game in my opinion. The costumization in this game is just insane. Over a million combinations possible with your character and vehicle design. Upgrades onto your weapons, character and car. Such as 'Increased car explosion radius' Or 'Mobile ammo box' Or for your charcter 'Kelvar implants' .... It's insane.

The gameplay is extremely fun to play, but also extremely easy to make you rage. My advise would be to play for short whiles. About 1 hour, take 15 minutes break and another hour. Other then all that, it's no P2W (You can buy weapons, but everything is normally achievable without having to pay), and you can really ♥♥♥♥ around with people, it's funny as hell!.
My rating on this game is 8.5/10

reviewText:
This game has one of the best character creators I've seen in a while, especially for a free to play title.
After I'd finished tweaking my characters' individual nostril hairs (exaggeration) I was ready to get started on the actual game and see what havoc I could get up to with my superbly shaped avatar.

Turns out, not all that much. Once you get to the actual game there really isn't much of anything going on and the first impressions are utterly horrid. Even a task as trivial as equipping a new shirt that you get for a mission reward had me stumped and after a decent deal of frustration and tedium I simply gave up.
Unintuitive, unbalanced and simply unfun.

If you want to waste half an hour in a pretty good character creator though, there's worse you can do.

reviewText:
Spend 90% of the time customising your character and 10% of the time getting shot

10/10

-------------------

On a serious note,

There are a lot of bad reviews for this game... if you are looking for a casual shooter game, this is NOT the game for you. Combat takes a suprising amount of skill, and this game is NOT noob friendly. It's very likely you'll lose your first few matches, very, very badly. What this game is, is a great game to play with a few friends, with some of the best character / vehicle / music customisation of any game I've played in a while.

The editors in this game are amazing, and there's no end to the level of creativity you find with what people make with the designers. The music studio is particularly good, and I'm a huge fan of it. I've found that with a bit of work, it's possible to create a HUGE variety of songs and music, and if that's something you enjoy, I would very highly recommend this game.

The gameplay is actually pretty good once you get the hang of combat. Matchmaking is not always the best, and sometimes it takes a bit of time to actually find a mission, but they tend to be good fun.

Vehicles in the game are quite hard to handle in some cases, which I see as a challenge, and a nice way to seperate those who are good at driving and those who aren't (I think I fall into the second catagory xD). There's also a nice variety, although it takes a lot of time to actually unlock any sort of body customization options for cars, and people who care a lot about that sort of thing might be forced into buying body kits with real money...

Character customisation, now that I get to it, it very thorough, and allows you to have a pretty good go at making whatever character you can think of. Designing outfits works really well, and is by far one of the best systems in the game other than the music editor.

-------------------

Long review over, I'd recommend trying this game... so far I've played w̶i̶t̶h̶o̶u̶t̶ ̶s̶p̶e̶n̶d̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶a̶n̶y̶ ̶m̶o̶n̶e̶y̶ (I've bought a̶ ̶f̶e̶w̶  far too many items from the store, although these are not really necessary to enjoy the game at all, in fact a few of my friends have spent nothing), if you're a bit of a car customisation fan, you may find yourself spending a bit, other than that, the game can be enjoyed a lot for free!

If you haven't tried this game yet, give it a go, you might be surprised :)
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
APB Reloaded is excellent in one category, character customization. It has a much more in depth system than any other game out there. Everywhere else, APB is one of the worse games on the market. After spending some hours on it, doing customization, you want to run around and do actual missions. That's cool. Unfortunately everyone logged on is much higher ranked than you, has better guns, and 80% of them are griefers that will follow you around and screw with you after the game. Granted, if you wanted to spend the money on this game, you could have these overpowered guns that nearly make the game P2W, but the 1000 or less people that are actually playing the game, really don't make it worth it. Or the fact that the game is not optimized for really any type of PC, which means everyone is laggy, and driving at full speeds is nearly impossible without several random crashes, or becoming one with a building. In my personal opinion, do not waste any time of your life in this game. You'll spend most of the time you do customizing your character and thinking about how much you hate the rest of the gameplay offered. Save yourself time and frustration and do not click install.

Update - 2/11/16

This game is still horrible. I got the random idea of reinstalling it and trying it again. The only thing worthwhile in this game, is still character customization. It's still plagued by morons and horribly repetitive gameplay. I'm... still confused as to why I thought it might have changed. The whole 'fool me once' quote comes to mind. Lesson learned.

reviewText: Best game I have played in a long time!

reviewText:
What I love about this game is that it is much more of out smarting your opponent than having a better gun. Even though sometimes guns can be over powered, most are balanced but easily better in certain situations. But with the proper team anything can be done. This game has it's glitches though and lag but nothing game breaking in my opinion. And hey it's free. If you do put money into it though it will reward your experience.

But the gameplay isn't the only thing that makes APB special. The customization is almost limitless. I've made several characters from movies (Batman, Iron Man, Captain America, Punisher, Superman etc.) and it's a lot of fun in my opinion. The customization is way beyond most games period. If not the best.

People are trying to fix some of the problems in the game as well. We'll be due for a new engine update soon, so hopefully that will fix most of the issues.

All in all this is my all time favorite MMO. Will you like it? I have no idea, but you should try it!

reviewText:
When I've heard about All Points Bulletin for the first time... God, I was excited. It was a fresh formula combining typical 'GTA sandbox' with MMO elements. I followed every pre-release video, trailer and so on. When It finally came out on the market (Funny thing, APB was meant to be free-to-play from the beginning. As we can see now - the chance for everyone to play was only for fabricating the hype) It wasn't really THAT bad...
I think that creators of the game condemned their game for failure just from the beginning. They didn't mentioned anything about the REAL formula of APB - 'cause APB isn't a GTA MMO - it's an online shooter with a really big arena and cars. Media and gamers called this game a 'GTA Online'. Back then, the developers didn't deny it.
APB had mostly technical issues, bugs and strange gameplay solutions. But it still offered much fun through customizing your car, your own character and shooting other people with this char. The game was fun to play, but had some unforgivable issues.
Now, about so called 'Reloaded' version. ABANDON ALL HOPE, YE WHO ENTER HERE. After so many years the new developers didn't removed 4 YEARS OLD bugs and technical issues. Seriously. What's more - practically, they have created more. The game may not even work on some PC configurations. I managed to launch original 2010 APB on Intel Core 2 Duo + GeForce 8600GTX, but for some reason, after many hours of fixing up the problem, APB:Reloaded won't last played for 0,5h on Intel i5 + Radeon HD7870. Because f*ck the player.
The game is fun to play itself, but after slow progress it can get bored for a while. Especially when you fight those Premium players. The disbalance of Premium and non-Premium characters is very big - in cash, in weapons, in experience and so on. There is even a limit on a graphics that you can put on clothes or cars. Seriously. Because f*ck the player.
Customization is still good, even after 4 years. What a shame, that it's so limited for a regular player. But you can still create something similar to your character of a dreams. You can slowly earn up for a car and car's modifications, but it is much longer process.
Driving a car is not very good because of server's delay. When you turn left, you send a signal to the servers of APB to make you drive left, and that causes some lags if you don't have a really good internet connection. This delay may be a bit similar to 'Hollywood car chase', but it's still a technical issue. Still not removed. Because f*ck the player.
Shooting is k, most of the time, sometimes your character will not shoot to your crosshair location, because s*it happens. It still fun, and that's an advantage of APB:R's gameplay.
There is a good variety of missions, as well as arenas, so you won't get bored in ~15 hours, at least I was still interested to play even, when I get to know all the game's missions.
If you get APB:Reloaded to work properly - it may be a fun and interesting experience, depends on your liking of 'GTA like' games. Otherwise, you will get upset many times, for sure.

tl;dr
Still fun to play, but with tons of technical issues and bugs, much disproportions between premium players and non premium players, try it out, 'cause it's free, darling, my final rating is 3-/6.

reviewText:
What I love about this game is that it is much more of out smarting your opponent than having a better gun. Even though sometimes guns can be over powered, most are balanced but easily better in certain situations. But with the proper team anything can be done. This game has it's glitches though and lag but nothing game breaking in my opinion. And hey it's free. If you do put money into it though it will reward your experience.

But the gameplay isn't the only thing that makes APB special. The customization is almost limitless. I've made several characters from movies (Batman, Iron Man, Captain America, Punisher, Superman etc.) and it's a lot of fun in my opinion. The customization is way beyond most games period. If not the best.

People are trying to fix some of the problems in the game as well. We'll be due for a new engine update soon, so hopefully that will fix most of the issues.

All in all this is my all time favorite MMO. Will you like it? I have no idea, but you should try it!

reviewText:
APB: Reloaded, a game where Pay-to-win is not optional but mandatory. I have some good and bad points that I would like to share with you but first you may notice my hours on the game don't seem like I have much experience. I can assure you that I have been playing APB: Reloaded for over 3 years now.

Anyway, onto the good points, this game has a wide-range of customisation options for pretty much anything from weapons to cars and everything inbetween (Mostly just cars, characters and weapons though). The wide array of customisation is what seperates the GTA (Grand Theft Auto) styled game from others such as APB: Reloaded.

As for the game itself it has a sort of unique" fighting style as a shot from a weapon does the same damage to the foot as it would to the head which draws in a much more casual audience who would prefer this fast-paced massive open world of carnage and mayhem. There are all kinds of different weapons in APB; High Velocity

helpfulPercent: LMG's and even High Explosive weapons featuring the OSMAW (RPG type weapon) and OPGL (Grenade Launcher). This open-world environment is ideal for the casual gamer who's looking to get a "thrill" in playing something like GTA

reviewText: Unfortunately I'm going to have to say this with a heavy heart. I do not recommend APB Reloaded. I put a lot of hours into this game and while it can be irritating it is really fun; but here's the kicker: once you're leveled up enough you then deal with hackers. In order to continue to play and actually have any decent fun, you need to hack yourself. It sounded dumb and at first and I did not believe the person who told me so I kept playing. But over the next couple of days I realized he was right. Not only do the players hack but while I played all the servers were hacked as well and these actions made it almost unplayable. The idea is great and the gameplay is great; but all the constant hacking done do this game ruins the fun. If it weren't for the hackers I'd highly recommend this game.

reviewText:
It's addictive, but it could have been so, so, so much better.

Obviously, the main attraction of this game is customization. They unfortunately lock the ability to make cool characters and cars behind tons of paywalls, level gates, and arbitrary progression. The only way to get anything is through missions and gunplay.

And on to gunplay. It's terrible. It's like a shooter from 2002. The weapons are horribly off balance, and any semblence of strategic gameplay is crippled by insta-win map locations.
